data.sentence: The word مَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to see, look at, glance, gaze, observe, behold, consider, regard, listen to, be patient towards, wait, contemplate, grant respite, put off, scrutinise, show kindness, examine, search, reflect. nazara - the look with affection, to perplex, dazzle.
data.sentence: The word يَنْظُرُونَ comes from the root ن ظ ر and is associated with the meanings: to see, look at, glance, gaze, observe, behold, consider, regard, listen to, be patient towards, wait, contemplate, grant respite, put off, scrutinise, show kindness, examine, search, reflect. nazara - the look with affection, to perplex, dazzle.

data.meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.
data.sentence: The word وَاحِدَةً comes from the root و ح د and is associated with the meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.

data.meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
data.sentence: The word صَيْحَةً comes from the root ص ي ح and is associated with the meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
The word تَأْخُذُهُمْ comes from the root ا خ ذ and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Contend in an altercation, dispute/litigate in a sound or valid manner, to say a thing such as may cause the listener to refrain/desist from his assertion/plea/claim, overcome someone in an altercation, antagonize, put a thing on the edge/side or corner of something.
data.sentence: The word يَخِصِّمُونَ comes from the root خ ص م and is associated with the meanings: Contend in an altercation, dispute/litigate in a sound or valid manner, to say a thing such as may cause the listener to refrain/desist from his assertion/plea/claim, overcome someone in an altercation, antagonize, put a thing on the edge/side or corner of something.
